text: There is a significant delay (at least several hours - this is what I observe, is this expected?) till servers that provide packages update their registry to newly tagged version of the package. This significantly complicates joint development of packages that depend on each other. The only solution I have found is to checkout `main` branch.

elements.text: There is a significant delay (at least several hours - this is what I observe, is this expected?) till servers that provide packages update their registry to newly tagged version of the package. This significantly complicates joint development of packages that depend on each other. The only solution I have found is to checkout
main
branch.

text:
> The only solution I have found is to checkout main branch
You can also run with `JULIA_PKG_SERVER=""` until the package server becomes faster at updating.

elements.text: The only solution I have found is to checkout main branch
You can also run with
JULIA_PKG_SERVER=""
until the package server becomes faster at updating.
main branch of what?
(of the dependency I guess)

text: See also <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/pkg-protocol-delay-in-updating-generalregistry/54521/> so it is possible something is stuck now, or have you experienced this more generally? I guess we have to wait until Elliot wakes up in some hours :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I experience it more generally. Even GH CI fails because of this, see: <https://github.com/JuliaData/DataFrames.jl/pull/2612/checks?check_run_id=1821862431>

elements.text: I experience it more generally. Even GH CI fails because of this, see:

text: Right, I just meant outside of this incident. It is expected to fail everywhere if the resource has not been stored yet.

elements.text: Right, I just meant outside of this incident. It is expected to fail everywhere if the resource has not been stored yet.

text: The storage servers are now advertising registry trees before they have processed all the contents, so there should not be a long delay

elements.text: The storage servers are now advertising registry trees before they have processed all the contents, so there should not be a long delay

text: Of course that also means that you can try to install something that the package servers can’t serve, but in that case it should still be installable from GitHub

elements.text: Of course that also means that you can try to install something that the package servers can’t serve, but in that case it should still be installable from GitHub

text: In this case they are stuck then; this is 20+ hours old: <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/29201>

elements.text: In this case they are stuck then; this is 20+ hours old:
can you take a look?

text: The size of delay is what I meant is problematic - I have seen the delays of at least like 12 hours several times already during last month.

elements.text: The size of delay is what I meant is problematic - I have seen the delays of at least like 12 hours several times already during last month.

text: Though for reference in R you need to wait several days, and when the team is on holiday nothing happens. :troll:

elements.text: Though for reference in R you need to wait several days, and when the team is on holiday nothing happens.

text: what I’m saying is that there should not be large delays at this point because the server is supposed to update almost immediately, before it has processed any of the contents of the registry

elements.text: what I’m saying is that there should not be large delays at this point because the server is supposed to update almost immediately, before it has processed any of the contents of the registry

text: so if there are delays then something is wrong
